intro: Oreocharis lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
